file_content.text: The fabled Voss. A few overblown words, and everybody rushes to one tiny little planet. Even us.
The sick, the desperate. All come with foolish hopes, leave with stories of "Mystics."
Mystics are leaders of the Voss people. Healers and prophets. Visions are never wrong.
Their predictions have all come true?
Never? That can't be right.
Stories say so. Could be more foolish hopes.
Hopefully, these Mystics will be interested in joining us.
They sound like worthy allies.
Most leave Voss empty-handed.
I'd prefer to be armed with some actual information.
I want more than rumors.
Don't know anything else. Voss is full of secrets.
It turns out both the Republic and the Empire believe these "stories." They're competing to sweet-talk the Voss into an alliance.
The Jedi Council should lead the negotiations.
Jedi diplomacy would help.
Apparently Voss upsets the Council's sensibilities. It calls the Mystics "gray Force users."
An ideological quibble, but it means your Council isn't lifting a finger to assist the Republic.
Word from the Senate is, the Council's keeping away from Voss on principle.
The Council claims these Mystics are Force users with no concept of "light" or "dark," and therefore, quite dangerous.
Who's winning so far?
And to the victor, the spoils.
The Voss. They're getting gifts of technology, trade, diplomats hanging on their every word.
Are the Voss so naive they don't realize the Empire is a threat?
The Voss tolerate Imperials?
The Imperials are behaving themselves. They tried an invasion a while back, but the Voss repelled it somehow.
There's a Republic ambassador in the Voss capital who might help us: Sophia Farash.
Perhaps she could get us to the Mystics.
One must listen in order to learn.
They do sound fascinating.
Fine, then listen. But we're not here to indulge your curiosity, we need soldiers and allies.
I'll see what she knows.
I need someone whose head hasn't been turned by this planet.
Hopefully she's sensible.
Watch yourself. Remember, if you pursue the Mystics, you'll be right in the Empire's way.
Be careful. The Empire may be all smiles in front of the Voss, but you're still the enemy.
